channel.title: Mike Walton on
channel.description: Recent content in Mike Walton on

item.title: Biomimicry
item.description: Biomimicry is basically taking a design challenge and then finding an ecosystem that’s already solved that challenge, and literally trying to emulate what you learn.

item.title: Booklist
item.description: Recent Reads [[books/emergent-strategy|Emergent Strategy]], Adrienne Maree Brown [[books/animal-architects|Animal Architects]], Carol Grant Gould & James L. Gould [[books/dispossessed|The Dispossessed]], Ursula K.

item.title: Current Doings
item.description: Autopoiesis: Playful musings on the study and [[thoughts/stewardship|stewardship]] of intelligent systems: artificial, natural, collective & complex. Scaling [[thoughts/participatory-design|Participatory]] Artificial Intelligence

item.title: Digital Garden
item.description: I was greatly inspired by Jacky Zhao’s approach to Networked Thought and decided to build my own garden using their excellent Quartz project.

item.title: iNaturalist
item.description: I’m always excited to find somethign new and curious I’ve never seen before, and adding new species to my observations recaptures the 90s magic of the Pokédex IRL.

item.title: Principles
item.description: While on sabbatical I wrote alot of rants and manifestos (none of which I’d ever dream of publishing). I had plenty of critiques of the direction of the Artificial Intelligence™ industry, but it began to become clear just how directionless my own thinking had become.

item.title: Projects
item.description: This is a list of notable projects and publications I’ve worked on. Find me on github or scholar for more!

item.title: Stewardship
item.description: In the physical world, there is a complex relationship between land development and land stewardship. Definitions vary (and often stewardship implys some form of development) but for our purposes we’ll follow the wikipedia-level defintion and refer to development as ‘changing landforms from a natural or semi-natural state for a purpose, such as agriculture or housing’.

item.title: Transparancy
item.description: Data Cards Playbook Reward Reports AIAAIC
